results.title: Growth of infant behaviour: Later stages
results.creator_credit: Arnold Gesell and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: A demonstration of the increasing ability of the growing infant to use his hands in manipulating objects. Shows the definite and predictable stages by which the hand grows from an almost useless organ to the dextrous and sensitive instrument of the human will.
results.description: A demonstration of the increasing ability of the growing infant to use his hands in manipulating objects. Shows the definite and predictable stages by which the hand grows from an almost useless organ to the dextrous and sensitive instrument of the human will.

results.creator_credit: Arnold Gesell and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: The activities and responses of an infant seated in a small chair in a photographic dome are recorded. Simultaneous side-by-side projection gives a comparisons of the same infant at different ages.

results.title: Growth of Cities
results.brief_description: A study of some of the factors, which determine the location and rate of expansion of cities, showing the general trend towards a centralization in USA. The factors involved in decentralization of cities, into metropolitan areas as applied to various types of cities, and various theories of city and town planning are presented.

results.title: Growth of adaptive behaviour
results.brief_description: This short film shows the development of adaptive behaviour in a child staring at 15 weeks and going through to 4 years; mainly with crayons. Shows the child’s 4 year old drawing revealing the pattern of adaptive behaviour.

results.title: Growth model
results.brief_description: Presents views on limits to growth, including the availability of space, decreasing stores of natural resources and reduced effectiveness of social institutions. Also offers a scenario of the life of a young couple living in a growing society which lacks stabilising mechanisms.

results.title: Growing, growing
results.brief_description: An experimental film showing young children exploring the mystery of plant growth. While watching their planat’s development, the children sing, write, recite, talk, film and make collages about plants. They revel in the elements of water, earth and sun which provides the plant’s nourishment.

results.title: Growing up safely
results.creator_credit: Jim Turpie and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A study of the child’s urge to move and explore, and of the dangers in wait from a baby’s first exploration of its crib to a young cyclist’s first encounter with traffic. Designed to help parents protect children from accidents and guide them safely through the vulnerable years when impulsive curiosity exceeds sense of caution.

results.title: Growing up on Cummera
results.creator_credit: May Andy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: May is a Yorta Yorta woman who grew up on Cummera Gunja mission. She warmly reflects on her days there, swimming and listening the the elders tell their stories. Moved away from her community, she experienced racism and prejudice but from those experiences learnt to overcome the boundries that others set up for her. She has since committed to a lifetime of learning and teaching and linking children and family back to their communities.
